Font

font.Rd

Functions to get or set the font property of huxtable cells.

font(ht)
font(ht) <- value
set_font(ht, row, col, value, byrow = FALSE)
map_font(ht, row, col, fn)

Arguments

ht

A huxtable.
value

A character vector of font names.

Set to NA to reset to the default, which is NA.
row

A row specifier. See rowspecs for details.
col

An optional column specifier.
fn

A mapping function. See mapping-functions for details.
byrow

Deprecated. Use by_cols() instead.

Value

For font, the font property. For set_font and map_font, the modified huxtable.

Details

LaTeX and HTML use different font names. If you want to use the same font names across document formats, set options("huxtable.latex_use_fontspec") to TRUE. See huxtable-options.

See also

Other formatting functions: background_color, bold, font_size, na_string, number_format, text_color

Examples


font(jams) <-  "times"
font(jams)
#>   Type    price  
#> 1 "times" "times"
#> 2 "times" "times"
#> 3 "times" "times"
#> 4 "times" "times"


jams2 <- set_font(jams,
      "times")
font(jams2)
#>   Type    price  
#> 1 "times" "times"
#> 2 "times" "times"
#> 3 "times" "times"
#> 4 "times" "times"

jams3 <- set_font(jams,
      2:3, 1, "times")
font(jams3)
#>   Type    price  
#> 1 "times" "times"
#> 2 "times" "times"
#> 3 "times" "times"
#> 4 "times" "times"

jams4 <- map_font(jams,
      by_rows(
        "times",
        "arial")
      )
font(jams4)
#>   Type    price  
#> 1 "times" "times"
#> 2 "arial" "arial"
#> 3 "times" "times"
#> 4 "arial" "arial"
